IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To solicit contributions from the general public to provide grants to high schools to support science, technology, engineering and mathematics programs and grants to researchers through our Innovation Grants Program.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To solicit contributions from the general public to provide grants to high schools to support science, technology, engineering and mathematics programs and grants to researchers at affiliated universities in NJ through the Innovation Grants Program. FHA holds educational seminars for innovators and students and is seeking contributions from these participants to support grants.
IRS990.Desc: The organization solicited contributions to fund its grant program to support high school STEM programs.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Charitable gift distributions to qualified charitable organizations made in accordance with recommendations made by donors.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Innovation grants are provided to researchers at affiliated universities for proof of concept prior to starting a company with an investment by FVCG. Donations are solicited to support this grant program.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Grants were provided to researchers to support work completed in accordance with donor restrictions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Foundation for Health Advancement files a tax return in the U.S. federal jurisdiction and is a registered charity in New Jersey. The foundation had no unrecognized tax liabilities or uncertain tax positions at June 30, 2023 and 2022. The organization did not have any tax related interest or penalties for the periods reported in the consolidated financial statements.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Innovation grants to advance technology of various researchers at the University.
Innovation grants to advance technology of various researchers at the University.
Innovation grants to advance technology of various researchers at the University.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: St Vincent de Paul RC Church

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Donor advised distribution for general operating support.
Donor advised distribution for general operating support.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Nativity of Our Lord RC Church

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Donor advised distribution for general operating support.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grants are awarded to organizations with affiliation agreements with FHA. These grants support specific research and technology subject to grant submission and approval by a grant committee. Final expenditure and programmatic reports are submitted at the conclusion of the grant, reviewed and accepted by grant administration.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The sole member of the Foundation for Health Advancement is New Jersey Health Foundation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is compiled by the VP of Finance of NJ Health Foundation/Foundation for Health Advancement with the assistance of the VP HR Administration. The completed draft return is sent to an outside tax professional who reviews the return. The completed return is then reviewed by the CEO and president. Modifications to the return based on those reviews are made. The board of directors reviews the return and provides any additional comments and recommendations. The 990 is finalized and sent to the board of directors prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All officers and directors must complete a conflict of interest questionnaire on an annual basis. In addition, all individuals completing the questionnaire acknowledge by signature that they agree to comply with the conflict of interest policy and to update the information provided in the event of any material change.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation for Health Advancement does not have any employees. New Jersey Health Foundation hires all employees. A management fee is charged by NJHF to FHA for services provided by employees of NJHF. NJHF maintains a formal process and compensation committee.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements of the organization are available upon request.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: Grant making supporting organization, endowment management

TransactionsRelatedOrgGrp.MethodOfAmountDeterminationTxt: Based on estimated time spent working on matters related to Foundation for Health Advancement of certain employees.
